name: SpharmDeco
author: Ziad S. Saad, SSCC/NIMH/NIH
description: Spherical Harmonics Decomposition of a surface's coordinates or data
command-line: SpharmDeco <-i_TYPE S> -unit_sph UNIT_SPH_LABEL> <-l L> [<-i_TYPE SD> ... | <-data D>] [-bases_prefix BASES] [<-prefix PREFIX>] [<-o_TYPE SDR> ...] [-debug DBG] [-sigma s]

inputs.description: Unit sphere, isotopic to the surface domain over which the data to be decomposed is defined.
inputs.name: Input type S

inputs.description: A surface whose node coordinates provide data vectors (X, Y, Z) to be decomposed or a dataset whose columns are to be individually decomposed. You can specify multiple surfaces to be processed.
inputs.name: Input type SD

inputs.description: Save the basis functions under the prefix BASES_PREFIX.
inputs.name: Bases prefix

inputs.description: Write out the reconstructed data into dataset PREFIX and write the beta coefficients for each processed data column.
inputs.name: Output prefix

inputs.description: Write out a new surface with reconstructed coordinates.
inputs.name: Output type SDR

inputs.description: Smoothing parameter (0 .. 0.001) which weighs down the contribution of higher order harmonics.
inputs.name: Smoothing sigma

output-files.description: File for harmonics of each order l.
output-files.name: Harmonics File

output-files.description: Beta coefficients for each data column.
output-files.name: Beta Coefficients File

output-files.description: Reconstructed data or surface files named based on PREFIX.
output-files.name: Reconstructed Data File
